intro: Lemmaphyllum subrostratum, commonly known as the narrow-lobed hakea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
